Finally, I don't work on this thing alone, of course! If you'd like to pitch longform stories or other features, pitch @mvzelenks. If you'd like to pitch something about health or science, pitch @acsifferlin. Shorter (800-1,600) tech stories are for me! 

Thank you!

1102635116667510788.text: Like I said earlier, I can't respond to every pitch. I'm also not super precious about getting nudged, though: Feel free to follow up with a new email if I don't respond in, say, a week. It's possible I still won't respond, but I'm trying to do better

1102635115891642369.text: What does an ideal pitch look like? I typically like a suggested headline, up to two paragraphs explaining the story, a proposed word count, and an idea of the sourcing you'll use. Again, you should email these to me at damon@medium.com.

1102635114947850242.text: (Last thing on that: If you have information that you'd like to share with me, even if you don't want to write the story yourself, that is also totally fine. I usually work with professional journalists but have also communicated with and edited tech workers!)

1102635113953873921.text: (A note on the "scoop" side of things: I'd love to help OneZero make news. We pay well and will support stories with fact checkers as necessary. If you have something sensitive, you can reach out to me for my Signal number, or we can find another way to make you comfortable.)pic.twitter.com/GKdS4A4i8P

1102635113140097024.text: I'm looking for stories about technology—and its place in the future—that feel urgent. They can be scoops, news analysis, think-pieces, essays... Typically, I work with stories that are between 800 and 1,600 words. You can reach me at damon@medium.com.

1102635110665519105.text: If you've pitched me in the past month and I haven't gotten back to you... I'm sorry!
